summary: Final Release - for ELFX (no enhancer) - This ENB preset is designed to give Skyrim a beautiful fantasy feeling without destroying the integrity of the game altogether.
descriptionHtml:
[center]********** SugarSweet ENB - Revamped for ELFX **********
********** Now featuring: Splenda ENB - a lighter preset **********
By: Beren

---------- Choose between Realism and Fantasy by simply alternating the palette.bmp file! (Very easy - directions included in download) ----------[/center][center]----- This preset aims to make Skyrim vibrant and beautiful - with dramatic yet believable lighting - without destroying your performance -----[/center]
[u]Credits:[/u]
- ChewieMuse for the original [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/28489/?]Beauty of Skyrim ENB[/url]
- Kyokushinoyama for permission to use his sunsprite and DoF files
- ZenonSeth for his work on the water and subsurface scattering

[url=http://textuploader.com/0i5r]Please click HERE for my full mod list and specs! - This also includes the armor and weapons you see in the screenshots[/url]
[center]
_________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
Installation:
_________________________________________________________________________________________________________________[/center]
1. Download [url=http://enbdev.com/]ENB V0.254 from ENBdev[/url] - link is at the bottom -- V0.262 should work fine for both versions
2. Extract only the d3d9.dll and enbhost.exe files and place them into your Skyrim directory

By default, your Skyrim directory is located here:
C:>>Program Files (x86)>>Steam>>SteamApps>>common>>Skyrim (where TES V is located)

3. Extract the contents of this download and place it into your Skyrim directory
4. Edit the following two lines in the ENBLOCAL.INI file to match YOUR SPECS - Google it if you have to
[center]
ReservedMemorySizeMb=xxx
VideoMemorySizeMb=xxxx[/center]
5. Download the REQUIRED mods - they are absolutely required if you want the game to look right
6. Open your Skyrim Launcher and disable Anisotropic Filtering and Anti-Aliasing
[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/TKo9iNel.png[/img]
_________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
Required Mods:
_________________________________________________________________________________________________________________[/center]
These mods are absolutely necessary in order for lighting to look right and the water to appear the way it is in the screenshots.
1. [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27043/?]ELFX[/url] - No enhancer, No exteriors
2. [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/52423/?]Pure Weather[/url]
3. [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/41076/?]Realistic Water Two - WITH OPTIONAL ENB TEXTURES[/url]
4. [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/48938/?]Watercolor for ENB[/url]
[center]_________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
Recommended Mods:
_________________________________________________________________________________________________________________[/center]
These mods help improve the game without affecting the lighting - highly recommended, but not required.

[u]Weather:[/u]
- [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/24460/?]Supreme and Volumetric Fog[/url]
- [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/4910/?]Dramatic Clouds[/url]

[u]Environment Textures:[/u]
- [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/42370/?]Unique Grasses and Groundcovers[/url]
- [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/51543/?]Unbelievable Grass[/url]
- [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49011/?]Quality Snow - 1K is good enough[/url]
- [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/607/?]Skyrim 2K Textures[/url]
[center]_________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
Recommended Mods for Parallax:
_________________________________________________________________________________________________________________[/center]
This ENB preset supports Parallax! (A type of 3D imaging) - these are the mods I use for parallax textures.
- [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/54540/?]Vivid Landscapes - Rocks & Mountains[/url]
- [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/39874/?]Vivid Landscapes - Dungeons & Ruins[/url]
- [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/18814/?]Project Parallax - Roads & Bridges
[/url]
[center]---------- SugarSweet ----------
[img]http://i.imgur.com/WOJMVBsl.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/ClqTvnxl.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/rv1ZO80l.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/Vhz73Njl.jpg[/img]

---------- SPLENDA ----------
[img]http://i.imgur.com/QpTabnfl.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/p4IAnSQl.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/8KDrvrQl.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/q4NGIIMl.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/2LrHkoMl.jpg[/img]
[/center]
